intro: Eriospermum mackenii subsp. phippsii, commonly known as the Phipps' eriosperm, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers adapted to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and has small, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, with a distinctive shape that aids in pollination by insects. It is often found in coastal or mountainous regions where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
